data.title: Despite Not Doing Films, Punjab Kings Owner Preity Zinta's Net Worth Is Soaring, Here's How!
data.meta_description: Preity Zinta the co-owner of PBKS, began her career with the film "Dil Se" in 1998, and has spent more than 25 years in Bollywood. Although the actress has been away from films for quite some time, she remains in the spotlight due to the IPL. Despite staying away from acting, Preity Zinta earns millions.
data.text:
The 17th season of IPL has begun fans buzzing with excitement as their favorite teams hit the field once again. The IPL is the second most popular sports league globally, with ten teams competing for the championship. Starting with just eight teams in 2008, the league has grown, and now players from 13 countries participate.

The recent media and digital rights deals highlight the league's massive popularity. Punjab Kings, one of the original IPL teams, has a huge fan base, even though they haven't won the trophy yet. Led by Shikhar Dhawan in 2024, they kicked off their season with a win against Delhi Capitals.

Preity Zinta the co-owner of PBKS, began her career with the film "Dil Se" in 1998, and has spent more than 25 years in Bollywood. Although the actress has been away from films for quite some time, she remains in the spotlight due to the IPL. Despite staying away from acting, Preity Zinta earns millions.

Punjab Kings valuation

Preity Zinta is a co-owner of Punjab Kings along with Ness Wadia, Karan Paul, and Mohit Burman. Back in 2008, Burman, Wadia, and Zinta joined hands to purchase Punjab Kings in a ratio of 2:1:1. Additionally, Saptarishi Dey from Dey & Dey Group holds a small share in the team. According to reports, the actress has invested Rs 35 crore in the team.

Also Read: Shubman Gill's Net Worth, Salary, Endorsements, Houses And Car Collection

Punjab Kings (Formerly known as Kings XI Punjab) since 2021, was purchased by Preity Zinta, Ness Wadia, Mohit Burman, and others. They bought the team for $76 million (around Rs 6.22 million crores) back in 2008. By 2022, Punjab Kings had become the ninth most valuable IPL Team, estimated at $925 million (around Rs 77.75 million crore). The actress, Preity Zinta, had invested a substantial $4.27 million (Rs 350 crore) in the team.

Preity Zinta: From Bollywood to IPL

Preity Zinta, known for her diverse roles, exemplifies how success in acting comes from skills, talent, and hard work. She's not just a talented actor but also influences women's fashion choices positively. Born on January 31, 1975, Preity grew up in an Army family, instilling in her strong values of hard work and diligence despite losing her parents at a young age.

She debuted in the industry in 1998 with Dil Se. She's famous for her roles in movies like Lakshya and Veer Zaara. According to Lifestyleasia, as of 2023, Zinta's net worth is estimated at around $30 million (Approx Rs 183 crore), showcasing her success in both entertainment and business.

In addition to being a co-owner of the cricket team Kings XI Punjab now called Punjabi Kings (PBKS) in the IPL, Preity Zinta is also a producer. She also does brand endorsements. On social media, the actress has 11 million followers. For one endorsement, Preity charges around 1.5 crore. Preity made history as the youngest co-owner of the IPL team Punjab Kings (formerly Kings XI Punjab), proving to be a lucky charm for the team.

Preity Zinta's Lavish Homes

Preity Zinta owns properties worth crores, stretching from India to California. The actress has several luxurious homes in Mumbai. One property she bought in 2023 is located in Pali Hill, Mumbai. Reports suggest Preity paid around 17 crore rupees for this house. Additionally, she also owns a house in Shimla, Himachal Pradesh, where she was born. The approximate value of this property is around 7 crore rupees.

Preity Zinta's Overseas Properties

After marriage, Preity Zinta lives with her husband in Los Angeles, California. They have their own home in Beverly Hills.

Car collection

The actress owns many cars, like a Lexus LX 470 Crossover valued at around $18,000 (approximately Rs 12 lakhs), a Porsche, a Mercedes Benz E Class worth about $87,319 (around Rs 58 lakhs), and a BMW.

Also Read: Shreyas Iyer's Net Worth, Salary, Brand Endorsements, Houses and Car Collection

Philanthropist

Zinta is also a philanthropist and has supported numerous charities over the years. In 2009, Preity displayed her compassion by adopting 34 girls from an orphanage in Rishikesh, promising to care for them as her own.

Marriage

Preity married Gene Goodenough in 2016 after five years of dating, choosing an intimate Hindu ceremony attended by close friends and family in Los Angeles. They auctioned their wedding photos for charity. With her infectious zest and warmth, Preity Zinta continues to inspire and spread kindness wherever she goes. We wish her all the success in her future endeavours.
